title: Power Pad Review: Premium Wireless Charger from Case-Mate
content: Power Pad Review: Premium Wireless Charger from Case-Mate By Todd Bernhard on Sat, 06/02/2018 I'm always looking for the best wireless charger, now that my whole household has Qi-based iPhones. The Power Pad ($60) from Case-Mate could be a contender. First, I like that it has 7.5 watts for fast charging. It accommodates phones via the included angled stand in portrait or landscape or it can be used in flat mode. It has a nice rubberized non-slip surface. Master your iPhone in one minute a day: Sign up to iPhone Life's Tip of the Day Newsletter and we'll send you a tip each day to save time and get the most out of your iPhone or iPad. The PowerPad is sold in white or black and while it uses USB for power, it has an integrated cable so it's always connected to the PowerPad. There is a riser piece to accommodate bigger devices, but be careful not to lose it. Pros 7.5 watts for fast charging Portrait, Landscape, and flat options Rubberized non-slip surface Available in white or black Integrated cable Cons Riser piece could get lost Final Verdict If you are looking for the best Qi-based wireless charger, the PowerPad from Case-Mate might be the best yet .  Master your iPhone in one minute a day: Sign up here to get our FREE Tip of the Day delivered right to your inbox. Topics:  Accessories CES iPhone Reviews Todd Bernhard Todd Bernhard is a bestselling (6+ million downloads) award-winning (AARP, About.com, BestAppEver.com, Digital Hollywood, and Verizon) developer and founder of NoTie.NET, an app developer specializing in Talking Ringtone apps including AutoRingtone. And his profile photo is of the last known sighting of Mr. Bernhard wearing a tie, circa 2007! An iPhone is almost always attached to his hip or in his pocket, but over the years, Mr. Bernhard has owned an Apple Newton, a Motorola Marco, an HP 95LX, a Compaq iPaq, a Palm Treo, and a Nokia e62. In addition to writing for iPhone Life, Mr. Bernhard has written for its sister publications, PocketPC Magazine and The HP Palmtop Paper.
contentWithMarkup:
I'm always looking for the best wireless charger, now that my whole household has Qi-based iPhones. The Power Pad ($60) from Case-Mate could be a contender. First, I like that it has 7.5 watts for fast charging. It accommodates phones via the included angled stand in portrait or landscape or it can be used in flat mode. It has a nice rubberized non-slip surface.

The PowerPad is sold in white or black and while it uses USB for power, it has an integrated cable so it's always connected to the PowerPad. There is a riser piece to accommodate bigger devices, but be careful not to lose it.

Pros

  • 7.5 watts for fast charging
  • Portrait, Landscape, and flat options
  • Rubberized non-slip surface
  • Available in white or black
  • Integrated cable

Cons

  • Riser piece could get lost

Final Verdict

If you are looking for the best Qi-based wireless charger, the PowerPad from Case-Mate might be the best yet .
